definition: to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
Myanmar (formerly Burma) (abbr. for 緬甸|缅甸[Mian3 dian4])
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)

sentences.english: I think it's a meaningful holiday just to benice to people and to remember people.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個有意義的節日，人們相互關愛，相互緬懷。

sentences.english: Tell me, did you visit the big-game country?
sentences.chinese: 你有沒有去了值得妳緬懷的地方。

sentences.english: We will miss Giacinto so much.
sentences.chinese: 我們將深切緬懷吉亞琴託。

sentences.english: The second part, the thought political lesson of the classroom teaching of rhythm control of necessity.
sentences.chinese: 第戀攬門，緬懷政治課的講堂學教節奏調控的須要性。

sentences.english: That our new generation of teenagers how to use the action to cherish the memory of martyrs do.
sentences.chinese: 那我們新一代的少年該怎樣用行動來緬懷先烈呢。

sentences.english: In recent times, the golden wattle has been used as a symbol of remembrance and reflection.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，人們常用金合歡來表達緬懷和紀念之情。

sentences.english: This year's Quidditch World Cup should be dedicated to their memory; it will be a chance to heal.
sentences.chinese: 今年的魁地奇世界盃應緬懷這些人，作爲愈傷的良機。

sentences.english: After all, we are all human, and all have family and friends to mourn for or be mourned by.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是人，都有要祭奠的以及將來緬懷親友。

sentences.english: A new guardrail was constructed in honor of the three lives lost.
sentences.chinese: 爲緬懷這三個人，人們修了一段護欄。

sentences.english: The act or process of recollecting past experiences or events.
sentences.chinese: 緬懷過去的經歷或事件的動作或者過程。

sentences.english: He lives in the past now,bethinking himself of happier days.
sentences.chinese: 他現在追念過去，緬懷往昔更美好的日子。

sentences.english: A golden wedding is the fiftieth everlasting nature of a married relineship.
sentences.chinese: 金婚是結婚五十週年緬懷日。

sentences.english: In ancient Egypt, people used to shave their eyebrows to mourn the death of their cats.
sentences.chinese: 在古埃及，人們經常通過剔眉毛的方式來緬懷死貓。

sentences.english: He said the day of remembrance is mixed with sorrow and incredible pride.
sentences.chinese: 他說，這個緬懷亡靈的日子充滿了哀傷和無盡的驕傲。

sentences.english: I tried not to cherish the memory of the past, as to when the road is impossible to turn back.
sentences.chinese: 我儘可能不去緬懷往事，因爲來時的路不可能回頭。

definition: to cherish the memory of/to think of/reminisce
to recollect/to recall (past times)/to look back
worthy predecessor/distinguished person of the past/former sage
to learn sth over again/to review/to brush up/to revive (memories, friendship etc)
to proclaim/to make public or well known
